revised_title: Structure and Properties of a Rich Hydrogen-Nitrogen-Oxygen Flame at Low Pressure
tldr: The authors examined the structure and properties of a rich hydrogen-nitrogen-oxygen flame at a pressure of 93 Torr, using experimental and theoretical methods. They found that the one-dimensional flame equations could not accurately predict the properties of flames with thicker reaction zones, and suggested that two-dimensional effects may play a larger role in these systems. The study provides insights into the behavior of low-pressure flames and their potential applications.
